intro: Trichotosia sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran trichotosia, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Trichotosia sumatrana is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
